recipe.title: Teriyaki Chicken Casserole
recipe.instructions: <action>Preheat</action> oven to 350° F. <action>Spray</action> a 9x13-inch baking pan with non-stick <action>spray</action>. <action>Combine</action> soy sauce, ½ cup water, brown sugar, ginger and garlic in a small saucepan and <action>cover</action>. <action>Bring</action> to a <action>boil</action> over medium <action>heat</action>. <action>Remove</action> lid and <action>cook</action> for one minute once boiling. Meanwhile, <action>stir</action> together the corn starch and 2 tablespoons of water in a separate dish until smooth. Once sauce is boiling, <action>add</action> mixture to the saucepan and <action>stir</action> to <action>combine</action>. <action>Cook</action> until the sauce starts to <action>thicken</action> then <action>remove</action> from <action>heat</action>. <action>Place</action> the chicken breasts in the prepared pan. <action>Pour</action> one cup of the sauce over <action>top</action> of chicken. <action>Place</action> chicken in oven and <action>bake</action> 35 minutes or until cooked through. <action>Remove</action> from oven and <action>shred</action> chicken in the dish using two forks. *Meanwhile, <action>steam</action> or <action>cook</action> the vegetables according to package directions. <action>Add</action> the cooked vegetables and rice to the casserole dish with the chicken. <action>Add</action> most of the remaining sauce, reserving a bit to <action>drizzle</action> over the <action>top</action> when serving. <action>Gently</action> <action>toss</action> everything together in the casserole dish until combined. <action>Return</action> to oven and <action>cook</action> 15 minutes. <action>Remove</action> from oven and <action>let</action> stand 5 minutes before serving. <action>Drizzle</action> each serving with remaining sauce. <action>Enjoy</action>!

recipe.title: Beef and Mustard Pie
recipe.instructions: <action>Preheat</action> the oven to 150C/300F/Gas 2. <action>Toss</action> the beef and flour together in a bowl with some <action>salt</action> and black <action>pepper</action>. <action>Heat</action> a large casserole until hot, <action>add</action> half of the rapeseed oil and enough of the beef to just <action>cover</action> the bottom of the casserole. <action>Fry</action> until browned on each side, then <action>remove</action> and <action>set</action> aside. <action>Repeat</action> with the remaining oil and beef. <action>Return</action> the beef to the pan, <action>add</action> the wine and <action>cook</action> until the volume of liquid has reduced by half, then <action>add</action> the stock, onion, carrots, thyme and mustard, and <action>season</action> well with <action>salt</action> and <action>pepper</action>. <action>Cover</action> with a lid and <action>place</action> in the oven for two hours. <action>Remove</action> from the oven, <action>check</action> the seasoning and <action>set</action> aside to <action>cool</action>. <action>Remove</action> the thyme. When the beef is <action>cool</action> and you're ready to <action>assemble</action> the pie, <action>preheat</action> the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. <action>Transfer</action> the beef to a pie dish, <action>brush</action> the rim with the beaten egg yolks and lay the pastry over the <action>top</action>. <action>Brush</action> the <action>top</action> of the pastry with more beaten egg. <action>Trim</action> the pastry so there is just enough excess to <action>crimp</action> the edges, then <action>place</action> in the oven and <action>bake</action> for 30 minutes, or until the pastry is golden-brown and cooked through. For the green beans, <action>bring</action> a saucepan of salted water to the <action>boil</action>, <action>add</action> the beans and <action>cook</action> for 4-5 minutes, or until just tender. <action>Drain</action> and <action>toss</action> with the butter, then <action>season</action> with black <action>pepper</action>. To <action>serve</action>, <action>place</action> a large spoonful of pie onto each <action>plate</action> with some green beans alongside.

recipe.title: BeaverTails
recipe.instructions: In the bowl of a stand mixer, <action>add</action> <action>warm</action> water, a big pinch of sugar and yeast. <action>Allow</action> to <action>sit</action> until frothy. Into the same bowl, <action>add</action> 1/2 cup sugar, <action>warm</action> milk, melted butter, eggs and <action>salt</action>, and <action>whisk</action> until combined. <action>Place</action> a dough hook on the mixer, <action>add</action> the flour with the machine on, until a smooth but slightly sticky dough forms. <action>Place</action> dough in a bowl, <action>cover</action> with plastic wrap, and <action>allow</action> to <action>proof</action> for 1 1/2 hours. <action>Cut</action> dough into 12 pieces, and roll out into long oval-like shapes about 1/4 inch thick that resemble a beaver’s tail. In a large, deep pot, <action>heat</action> oil to 350 degrees. <action>Gently</action> <action>place</action> beavertail dough into hot oil and <action>cook</action> for 30 to 45 seconds on each side until golden brown. <action>Drain</action> on paper towels, and <action>garnish</action> as desired. <action>Toss</action> in cinnamon sugar, in white sugar with a squeeze of lemon, or with a generous slathering of Nutella and a handful of toasted almonds. <action>Enjoy</action>!

recipe.title: Big Mac
recipe.instructions: For the Big Mac sauce, <action>combine</action> all the ingredients in a bowl, <action>season</action> with <action>salt</action> and <action>chill</action> until ready to use. 2. To make the patties, <action>season</action> the <action>mince</action> with <action>salt</action> and <action>pepper</action> and <action>form</action> into 4 balls using about 1/3 cup <action>mince</action> each. <action>Place</action> each onto a square of baking paper and <action>flatten</action> to <action>form</action> into four x 15cm circles. <action>Heat</action> oil in a large frypan over high <action>heat</action>. In 2 batches, <action>cook</action> beef patties for 1-2 minutes each side until <action>lightly</action> charred and cooked through. <action>Remove</action> from <action>heat</action> and <action>keep</action> <action>warm</action>. <action>Repeat</action> with remaining two patties. 3. <action>Carefully</action> <action>slice</action> each burger bun into three acrossways, then <action>lightly</action> <action>toast</action>. 4. To <action>assemble</action> the burgers, <action>spread</action> a little Big Mac sauce over the bottom base. <action>Top</action> with some chopped onion, shredded lettuce, <action>slice</action> of cheese, beef patty and some pickle slices. <action>Top</action> with the middle bun <action>layer</action>, and <action>spread</action> with more Big Mac sauce, onion, lettuce, pickles, beef patty and then <action>finish</action> with more sauce. <action>Top</action> with burger lid to <action>serve</action>. 5. After waiting half an hour for your food to <action>settle</action>, <action>go</action> for a <action>jog</action>.

recipe.title: Corba
recipe.instructions: <action>Pick</action> through your lentils for any foreign debris, <action>rinse</action> them 2 or 3 times, <action>drain</action>, and <action>set</action> aside. Fair warning, this will probably turn your lentils into a solid block that you’ll have to <action>break</action> up later In a large pot over medium-high <action>heat</action>, sauté the olive oil and the onion with a pinch of <action>salt</action> for about 3 minutes, then <action>add</action> the carrots and <action>cook</action> for another 3 minutes. <action>Add</action> the tomato paste and <action>stir</action> it around for around 1 minute. Now <action>add</action> the cumin, paprika, mint, thyme, black <action>pepper</action>, and red <action>pepper</action> as quickly as you can and <action>stir</action> for 10 seconds to <action>bloom</action> the spices. <action>Congratulate</action> yourself on how amazing your house now smells. Immediately <action>add</action> the lentils, water, broth, and <action>salt</action>. <action>Bring</action> the soup to a (gentle) <action>boil</action>. After it has come to a <action>boil</action>, <action>reduce</action> <action>heat</action> to medium-low, <action>cover</action> the pot halfway, and <action>cook</action> for 15-20 minutes or until the lentils have fallen apart and the carrots are completely cooked. After the soup has cooked and the lentils are tender, <action>blend</action> the soup either in a blender or simply use a hand blender to reach the consistency you desire. <action>Taste</action> for seasoning and <action>add</action> more <action>salt</action> if necessary. <action>Serve</action> with crushed-up crackers, torn up bread, or something else to <action>add</action> some extra thickness. You could also use a traditional thickener (like cornstarch or flour), but I prefer to <action>add</action> crackers for some texture and saltiness. Makes great leftovers, stays good in the fridge for about a week.
